data.title: Documentation to support HIDPI  in project
data.body:
Godot 2.1

I already asked the community [(linc),](https://godotengine.org/qa/6388/hidpi-in-projects) but as I suspected, is too new.

I repeat, with the release of version 2.1, actual question "HIDPI support in projects". As I understand it, now there are such means in the Arsenal of Godot.

I looked at the project settings dialogue, and found some interesting new properties:
![0000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11189223/17131553/ad8cd4d0-5326-11e6-9589-96d9eaa1fe39.png)

I test them all turned and ran the demo. The demo used a standard skin Godot. I get the expected result - support HIDPI. But when I used the demo with a different skin... I needed a magnifying glass.

Need to document support HIDPI in projects.

P.S.: Please advise me how can I correctly implement support for HIDPI in your project. For me it is very important. I want to make sure that do not have to redo it.

data.title: Android - Clean Up
data.body:
- AndroidManifest.xml.template ==> For better understanding each elements, better looking, and should prefend messing up with added chunk attributes (at least, for me). Also, some R.attr for configChanges was added.
- build.gradle.template ==> In the same spirit of mentioned above.
- detect.py ==> Reverted android-14 to android-15 as 15 close to 4.+ and/or 5+ while still supporting android 2.3.3 (Gingerbread-API10) quite well.

data.title: Usability: Recommend Game Window Doesn't Obstruct Play Controls By Default
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any OS, any Godot version

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When developing it's a bit of a hassle to close an errored game window because you can't press F8 like you could had there not been said error. So you've either got to drag the game window down and press stop, or you've got to click the editor to get focus and then press stop. Trying repeating this 5 times (or more) in a row when you've got a lot of errors in your code. :)

I'd recommend the default window width and height be set to something like 800 by 600 respectively. That way you still get a good sized window for testing and you can still reach the controls with a single click. Then when your game is running smoothly you can switch to full screen mode.

I posted a [similar issue](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5762) here.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

closes #1990

Win7 x64, Godot v2.1rc1

App crashes if there's FileDialog in the scene. It works/looks more like a stopping scene right after running it.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just add FileDialog anywhere to the scene.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
^ Up ^

data.title: Expose Drag And drop to gdscript more
data.body:
This is a continuation of 
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5625

basically Godot master now has support for drag and drop - but it is not complete. It has a number of missing key elements.

 [ ]Ability to determine on which node the files have been dropped on - Currently drag and drop event is triggered regardless of where on the application window you drop the files. As a result your application can not have more than one drag and drop areas.

I tried doing it with focus_enter and focus_exit signals and a variable. Didnt work. Focus enter signal requires the user to click on the node - which doesnt work with drag and drop.

[ ] The 'Screen' value is always returning a 0 -

> @TheHx What does the 'screen' (string) value do? I noticed that it always returns a zero.
> 
> @TheHX  :
> I'm not sure, but i think the screen parameter is index of the from where the files are dragged, but as it seems the feature is not implemented:
> https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/windows/os_windows.cpp#L767
> https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/x11/os_x11.cpp#L1531
> https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/osx/os_osx.mm#L330

I suggested adding a on_files_dropped signal to GUI nodes in godot - but I am not sure if thats the best solution.

Another suggestion is to add a signal to nodes that fires when the mouse has hovered on them. As noted earlier focus_enter and focus_exit dont work in this case because they trigger only if the user clicks. Cant click while you are dragging a file.

So if anyone has any idea how to do this properly or has a workaround - thanks in advance. :)

data.title: 3D KinematicBody is not correctly detecting collision with PlaneShape
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.1 RC1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The KinematicBody `is_colliding()` function does not return true when the body is colliding with an object that has a PlaneShape collision shape. It does still get stopped by the object, but doesn't report the collision.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a StaticBody with a PlaneShape collision. Create a KinematicBody with a simple BoxShape collision, and add a script to it to move into the StaticBody. Print `is_colliding()`

data.title: GLES2: Check for GPU capabilities to display an error
data.body:
The engine will still segfault, but the error message should be displayed by the
OS in a blocking manner, so that it will only crash once users have acknowledged
the error dialog.

**Please test**, especially if you have hardware that does not support GL 2.1 / GLES 2.0. I only tested on Linux X11, and by tweaking the `if` to make it fail when GL 2.1 was actually supported. @SuperUserNameMan's test in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/1162#issuecomment-235047879 seems to indicate that it would be working on Windows for his hardware.

Closes #1162.

data.title: Collapsed nodes in the shader graph
data.body:
Mac OSX El Capitan - Godot 2.1 RC.

When deleting a node in shader graph, with other nodes selected all selected nodes are "collapsed" at the mouse position.

To reproduce:
- Open a shader graph with some nodes
- Select some of them (sometimes they are automatically selected)
- Delete one node (clicking on x)
- Move the mouse -> all selected nodes are collapsed. (if you double click when deleting this does not happen)

data.title: Relative mouse motion is unreliable at scale ratios != 1:1 (rounding errors)
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Changed the issue to address the root cause of the symptoms that are described hereafter.

The problem is that the relative mouse motion is limited to integers, and thus unreliable as soon as the scale is different from (1,1). E.g. at a scale of (2,2), only mouse motion deltas of multiples of 2px will be detected; 1px delta will be seen as 0, 3px as 1.

Reproducer: [mousemotion_relative.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/384518/mousemotion_relative.zip)
Use the LineEdit to change the scale, and experiment a bit with moving the mouse. Left mouse click resets the "drag origin" value.

---

Mac OSX El Capitan - Godot 2.1 RC.

Shader graphs nodes only are displaced correctly when scale factor is 1:1. Otherwise, when moving a node, they move less distance than the mouse moved distance. Seems like a factor is needed to compensate the scale and translate the real movement to shader graph units.

To reproduce:
- Open a shader graph with some nodes
- Move a node with 1:1 zoom
- Increase or decrease the zoom level
- Move the node -> Moved distances does not match the mouse moved distance

data.title: Project list is not ordering by favorites
data.body:
Mac OSX El Capitan - Godot 2.1 RC.

This could not be a bug... but If I recall correctly, in previous versions, when marking a project in the project list as favorite (with the star) these projects were listed before the other projects. This seems not to be the case now. Even marking a project as favorite is listed last.

To reproduce:
- Create a project
- Add samples project by searching
- Mark the first created project as favorite (the star)
- Quit godot
- Start godot -> The favorite project is not at the top

**Steps to reproduce:**
Download the project from github, and select export with the above parameters

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
It is **not** a minimal example because I want to **exactly** export this game for OS X and not a minimal example. Minimal examples fails too. But the issue is not the game itself but the export action combined with Godot version and OS X version
https://github.com/genete/JetPac

but if I export manually from the export menu, it works.

data.title: Fix some warnings
event.is_action(...) returns false for release events of modifier keys (ctrl, alt)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Debian Linux X11 64bit
Godot 2.0.4.1 and 2.1-rc1

**Issue description**:

When handling input events with `_input()`, for input map actions triggered by modifier keys (tested: ctrl, alt), only the press event has its `is_action()` report `true` - the release event reports `false` for that same action name.

Expected behaviour is for both the press and release events of modifier keys to return the same value for `event.is_action(...)`.

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
extends Sprite

func _ready():
    set_process_input(true)

func _input(event):
    if event.is_action("boop"):
        set_flip_v(event.is_pressed())
```

When triggered by a modifier key, the Sprite is never un-flipped.

**Link to minimal example project**:

https://github.com/raumkraut/godot-tests
Open and run "input.tscn".
Space and Ctrl are set up to flip/unflip the sprite.

data.title: Allow to set main scene directly in "No main scene defined" popup
data.body: This is a small enhancement idea, but it would save time to be able to click "Set current as main" when you want to run the project but no main scene is defined. This way you won't have to close the popup, go to settings, find the option, click open file, find the scene, select it etc.

data.title: Filesystem messed up after creating a res directory
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS: Windows 10 x64
Godot commit c83aa5f86383bf89871f0a41752f5c6eeb148950

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I created a directory under res:// and named that directory to 'res' then the filesystem tree messed up and displayed tons of repeating res:// copies. 
![ScreenShot](http://up.vbiran.ir/uploads/6818146937616632452_Untitled.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a directory named res under res:// and include/import a resource from there into your project. I don't know if the same thing might happen if you create a res directory under another directory

data.title: Move hardcoded theme colors from editor_node into editor_themes
Editor crash when a node with a non-tool script is selected with EditorPlugin
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 beta, Windows 10 64 bits

I am learning how to create an EditorPlugin for my terrain tool, but suddenly it started to crash. I didn't managed to get my plugin detected on Godot 2.0.4 so I could only reproduce this in 2.1 beta:

[EditorPluginCrash.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/380294/EditorPluginCrash.zip)
Open this project, and when the main scene opens, directly select the Camera node in the Scene Tree. Observe a crash.
If it doesn't works, try again, selecting nodes and then the Camera again, or restart the editor (it's a 50% repro on my PC).

The only error I get in the console is this one:

```
ERROR: ConfigFile::get_section_keys: Condition ' !values.has(p_section) ' is true.
   At: core\io\config_file.cpp:114
```

data.title: TSCN/TRES subresource random reordering of CollisionPolygon2Ds
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, git master HEAD

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Loading a tileset source TSCN and saving it, and/or exporting/saving again an existing TRES tileset resource generates random redistribution of the subresources' IDs, leading to unnecessary diffs.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download the attached minimal example, which is a zipped git repo (so that changes can be seen with `git diff`)
2. Load `mountain_tileset.tscn` in the editor, export the TileSet to overwrite `mountain_tileset.tres` (make sure to untick "Merge with existing").
3. Check the `git diff`: it might show some random reordering of the subresources in `mountain_tileset.tres`. If it doesn't, close the editor, and repeat step 2 and 3. It might take several attempts to happen.
4. Once you have a diff, `git add .` the changes to take it as the new "reference" (in case the previous state was actually bad).
5. Repeat steps 2 and 3; depending on your luck, you might see the previous changes being reverted again. Saving `TileMap.tscn` might also exhibit the issue, as it resaves the TRES resource.

The behaviour is a bit non-deterministic, it kind of looks like the order of the subresources depends on the time, or the way the resources were loaded into memory in the editor, etc.

At any rate, some way should be found to ensure that such resources won't get randomly reordered, and ideally they should be sorted by ascending IDs.

Example diff:

``` diff
diff --git a/mountain_tileset.tres b/mountain_tileset.tres
index 0a6adab..7ded8df 100644
--- a/mountain_tileset.tres
+++ b/mountain_tileset.tres
@@ -7,82 +7,82 @@
 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 24, 64, 24, 64, 128, 0, 128 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=2]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=10]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 128, 0, 128, 32, 96, 64, 0, 64 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=3]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=11]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 80, 0, 128, 24, 128, 128, 0, 128 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=4]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=12]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 96, 0, 128, 16, 128, 40, 96, 128, 0, 128 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=5]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=13]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 16, 16, 16, 0, 40 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=6]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=14]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 16, 128, 16, 128, 40, 0, 40 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=7]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=15]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 24, 48, 24, 64, 56, 64, 192, 0, 192 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=8]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=16]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 56, 128, 56, 128, 192, 0, 192 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=9]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=17]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 56, 64, 56, 64, 192, 0, 192 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=10]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=2]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 128, 192, 0, 192, 0, 24, 64, 48, 128, 88 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=11]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=3]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 24, 64, 88, 64, 192, 0, 192 )

-[sub_resource type="ConcavePolygonShape2D" id=12]
+[sub_resource type="ConcavePolygonShape2D" id=4]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 segments = Vector2Array( 0, 24, 64, 72, 64, 72, 128, 88, 128, 88, 128, 192, 128, 192, 0, 192, 0, 192, 0, 24 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=13]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=5]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 24, 128, 24, 96, 128, 0, 128 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=14]
+[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=6]

 custom_solver_bias = 0.0
 points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 96, 0, 96, 128, 0, 128 )

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=15]

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=16]

-[sub_resource type="ConvexPolygonShape2D" id=17]

@@ -112,7 +112,7 @@ points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 64, 0, 64, 96, 0, 32 )

 15/texture = ExtResource( 1 )
 15/tex_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
@@ -216,7 +216,7 @@ points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 64, 0, 64, 96, 0, 32 )
 15/occluder_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 15/navigation_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 15/shape_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
-15/shapes = [ SubResource( 7 ) ]
+15/shapes = [ SubResource( 15 ) ]
 16/name = "Step"
 16/texture = ExtResource( 1 )
 16/tex_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
@@ -224,7 +224,7 @@ points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 64, 0, 64, 96, 0, 32 )
 16/occluder_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 16/navigation_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 16/shape_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
-16/shapes = [ SubResource( 8 ) ]
+16/shapes = [ SubResource( 16 ) ]
 17/name = "StepDown"
 17/texture = ExtResource( 1 )
 17/tex_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
@@ -232,7 +232,7 @@ points = Vector2Array( 0, 0, 64, 0, 64, 96, 0, 32 )
 17/occluder_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 17/navigation_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
 17/shape_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
-17/shapes = [ SubResource( 9 ) ]
+17/shapes = [ SubResource( 17 ) ]
 18/name = "DarkDetail 1"
 18/texture = ExtResource( 1 )
 18/tex_offset = Vector2( 0, 0 )
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[tres_subresource_reordering.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/380242/tres_subresource_reordering.zip)

data.title: 2.1 Beta "stop mouse" no longer stops event when mouse button 4 or 5 is pressed
data.body:
2.1 Beta _20160721_ / on Linux

**Issue description** :
When hovering over a control node, with "stop mouse" enabled, and scrolling with the mouse wheel, the control node and its parent node both receive the input_event(event). Happens only for mouse button 4 and 5, normal mouse button presses 1 to 3 are not received by the parent control.

**Link to minimal example project**:
[ui.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/380220/ui.tar.gz)

data.title: Having more general information icons for the scene panel.
data.body: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67740160/Scene_Panel.png - the popup node has a warning icon next to it. Clicking on it will tell you about the node's default behaviour. This doesn't appear to be something to _warn_ about, although it's still obviously a notification. Maybe a more general "information"-style icon in addition (for things like this) would be nice?
